DATA.title: Integrate real-time gas fee oracle modules for ≥3 networks
DATA.summary: Integrate real-time gas fee oracle modules capable of providing accurate transaction cost estimates on at least three blockchain networks, such as Ethereum and Polygon. These integrations will enable the backend system to dynamically fetch gas fees, ensuring broad network coverage and up-to-date fee data. The capability is foundational for a responsive, accurate fee estimation workflow in blockchain wallet platforms.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: integrating a real-time gas-fee estimation feature ... for different transaction types across at least three supported blockchain networks

DATA.title: Display dynamic min/expected/max gas fee estimates in UI pre-confirmation
DATA.summary: Provide users with real-time minimum, expected, and maximum gas fee estimates in the user interface before transaction confirmation. The UI must update these values dynamically, improving transparency and predictability for users prior to finalizing blockchain transactions. This enhances trust and allows informed user decisions regarding transaction costs.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: users must see a range of estimated gas fees (min/expected/max) ... UI displaying the fee and total cost

DATA.title: Enable fee estimation for multiple transaction types (transfer, contract, swap)
DATA.summary: Extend the fee estimation engine to cover various transaction types, including simple transfers, smart contract executions, and token swaps. This ensures that users receive accurate fee estimates regardless of transaction complexity or context, upholding broad use-case coverage. This capability is crucial for consistent experience across different wallet activities.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: estimated gas fees ... for different transaction types ... transfer, contract, swap

DATA.title: Support advanced gas parameter adjustment with inline guidance
DATA.summary: Allow users to modify advanced gas parameters such as gas limit and price, with UI providing inline help to guide novice and experienced users alike. This feature increases control and flexibility while reducing risk of misconfiguration. Inline guidance raises overall usability and educates users about transaction mechanics.

DATA.title: Highlight fee spikes and advise users in case of pending pool congestion
DATA.summary: The system should detect pending pool congestion and visible fee spikes, alerting users and giving actionable advice prior to confirmation. Notification ensures users are aware of unusual fee situations that could impact cost or transaction timing. This proactive interaction helps prevent user frustration and costly mistakes.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Highlight fee spikes and advise users in case of pending pool congestion

DATA.title: Warn users and suggest actions if fee data is delayed or inaccurate
DATA.summary: Implement logic to warn users if gas fee data is outdated or cannot be reliably fetched, and offer suggestions such as retrying later or reviewing network status. This improves reliability by preventing misinformed confirmations and enhances trust by actively addressing data uncertainty.

DATA.title: Disable transaction confirmation if estimation unavailable
DATA.summary: Automatically block or disable transaction confirmation when fee estimation fails or is unavailable, ensuring users cannot unknowingly proceed with potentially incorrect costs. This measure protects users and prevents critical mistakes arising from missing fee data.

DATA.summary: All user data and transaction parameters must be handled securely in accordance with privacy policies and regulatory standards. This requirement includes data encryption, access control, and secure storage, ensuring user information is protected against misuse or unauthorized access.
